Now Trump ’ s White House takes the Statue of Liberty
The surest sign of regime change is when they start attacking the statues .
The Americans appreciate this , as do any other – hence the carefully staged overthrow of Saddam Hussein on the Firdos Square in Baghdad in 2003 .

Stephen Miller , one of the Trump regime ’ s key ideologues , certainly knew what he did when he adopted a symbolic axe in a heated dispute with CNN ’ s Jim Acosta about the president ’ s proposals to drastically restrict legal immigration .
To remain fair , Miller did not attack the statue himself .
A Horde of boat owners and liberty-imitators would have lynched him if he had done so .
But it took on its significance , and in particular the importance attributed to it when the famous poem of Emma Lazarus was added to its base in 1903 , 17 years after the monument was completed .
As Miller Acosta exclaimed : " I don 't want to go into a complete thing about history , but the Statue of Liberty is ... a symbol of American freedom that lights up the world .
The poem you refer to , which was added later and is not part of the original Statue of Liberty . '
Miller is factually correct , but as he put it himself , it is not really about history .

It is about the contemporary response to Lazarus 's stirring words , the only one in which a state invites not only any old immigrants , but the poorest of the poor : ' Your idlings , your poor , / your beleaguered masses who yearn for free breathing / the miserable waste of your coasts ' .
There was never a time when the " miserable waste " on our screens was better seen .
Miller was not engaged in literary criticism - he made it clear that these people are not welcome in Trump ’ s US .
This conflict , because of the importance of a statue , is part of a broader political and cultural debate : it is indeed a conflict over the importance of America .
Lazarus - and their friends , who used to place their words on the ground after their death - knew very well that they were doing a highly political act .
The sculpture was intended to show the links between French and American Republicanism by representing the female embodiment of freedom in a worn out classical pictorial representation .
Lazarus changed this meaning : in her poem the female figure is no longer abstract - she has received a voice .
And it gives itself a very different name : the mother of the exiles .
The combination of the poem with the image is a brilliant feminist coup and a devastating attack on American nativism .
And just as Lazarus changed the meaning of the statue , people from the right wing wanted to change this for a long time .

The great scream of Rush Limbaugh , a kind of John the Baptist for Trump ’ s coming , argued in 2010 that the Statue of Liberty was not inviting anyone , but rather an early neo-conservative who brought the American flame to the surrounding world : " Lady Liberty is advancing .
It is supposed to carry the torch of freedom from the United States to the rest of the world .
The torch should not lead the way to the United States . '
It 's quite unusual that Limbaugh came across something here .
The importance of the statue is a question of the position of perception .
The great imaginative act of Lazarus was to see them as seen by the exhausted , miserable but hopeful people after long and often terrible journeys on the decks of ships .
It is literally a matter of seeing the world from the perspective of people seeking refuge and an opportunity to improve their lives .
Her statue speaks to them the words of hope and welcome they must hear .
And that , of course , is not the prospect that Miller and Trump would ever want to recognize .
Their torch is not meant to enlighten the way , but to ignite the hatred that is their only source of power .

Poverty and Death in Indonesia ’ s Gold Land
When Bardina Degri cooks dinner , she does not use a stove .
It even rarely uses a pot .

After half an hour , the charred bulb is taken from and swallowed up with eager , unwashed hands .
Deeperi is sitting on the clay floor - she has no furniture - where she also performs her daily work , for example , washing clothes with muddy water from the nearby swamp .
A bucket in a roofless room serves as a lantern .
As the youngest of her husband ’ s four wives , no fields were assigned to her .
Polygamy is common here .
Of course , late work can be dangerous : most village men are unemployed and many drink hard , and there are soldiers here .
Nobody dares to walk around in the village after 5 p.m.  she says .

It is a rare insight into daily life in the highlands of Papua , a former Dutch colony that was admitted in 1969 after a controversial referendum in Indonesia , when only 1,026 elders were to vote in front of the occupying forces through a public hand-picking .

An existing movement that sought independence against Dutch rule quickly turned against the government of Jakarta , which maintains control of the region , excluding foreign journalists or right-wing observers .
In 2003 the province was officially divided into Papua and West Papua , with the independent part of Papua New Guinea covering the eastern part of the island .
Enarotali is as remote as it is .
There is no public transport .
The town of 19,000 inhabitants consists of wooden houses surrounded by bamboo fences and corrugated iron roofs , which were converted into different yellowish-brown tones by rust .
Few Indonesians have travelled here , let alone journalists and virtually no foreigners .
Before Christian missionaries arrived , Mee Pago Papuans worshipped a god called Uga Tamee .
There have also been other changes .
We were not used to wearing these clothes ,  says Degei , pointing to her vivid , hand-woven turban , her dark shirt and her bright skirt .
We used to have leaves on our bodies .
Papua is Indonesia ’ s poorest province , where 28 % of people live below the poverty line and some of Asia ’ s worst infant mortality and literacy rates .
But it is also Indonesia ’ s gold land .

The largest and most profitable gold mine in the world , Grasberg , owned by Freeport McMoran from Phoenix , is only 60 miles from Paniai , a highland province in the size of New Jersey with 153,000 inhabitants .
In 2015 alone , Freeport has cut $ 3.1 billion in gold and copper .
In addition , Papua has an estimated $ 78 billion in wood resources .
But these riches are a source of misery for the Papua , ensuring that Indonesia ’ s powerful military maintains a suffocating presence .
A 2005 study in the New York Times reported that Freeport paid local military personnel and units nearly $ 20 million between 1998 and 2004 , including up to $ 150,000 to a single officer .
Papuan ’ s demands for greater autonomy threaten this golden goose and are treated mercilessly .
According to activists , more than 500,000 Papua has been killed and thousands have been raped , tortured and imprisoned by the Indonesian military since 1969 .
Mass killings in Papuas tribal highlands in the 1970 ’ s became genocide according to the Asia Human Rights Commission .
In the region alone , the Indonesian police arrested more than 3,900 peaceful demonstrators last year .

In fact , only two months after Jokowi ’ s inauguration in October , Paniai suffered a low point .
On December 7 , 2014 , a group of 11 children was out and sang Christmas songs in front of a campfire in Enarotali , when two Indonesian soldiers broke through the darkness on a motorcycle .

A few hours later , the building of the nearby government commission was set on fire , and things escalated the next day .
About 1,000 young Papua men , women and children gathered at a football pitch in front of the local police station and the military command center to demand justice .
They carried ceremonial hunting bows and performed the Waita dance - running in circles and imitating a bird 's song - of Papuas Mee Pago tribe .
Some demonstrators began to throw stones on police and military posts .

When the mood was heated up , the soldiers were sent a command via an internal radio : " If the masses resist more than three times , they shoot them dead , " says TIME 's official document , which was not released to the local media .
